<a id="ScriptEditor"></a>

# ScriptEditor

**Inherits:** [PanelContainer](PanelContainer.md) **\<** [Container](Container.md) **\<** [Control](Control.md) **\<** [CanvasItem](CanvasItem.md) **\<** [Node](Node.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

Redot editor's script editor.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

Redot editor's script editor.

\ **Note:** This class shouldn't be instantiated directly. Instead, access the singleton using [EditorInterface.get_script_editor()](EditorInterface.md#EditorInterface_method_get_script_editor).

<!-- classref-reftable-group -->

## Signals

<a id="ScriptEditor_signal_editor_script_changed"></a>

<!-- classref-signal -->

**editor_script_changed**\ (\ script\: [Script](Script.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#ScriptEditor_signal_editor_script_changed)

Emitted when user changed active script. Argument is a freshly activated [Script](Script.md).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="ScriptEditor_signal_script_close"></a>

<!-- classref-signal -->

**script_close**\ (\ script\: [Script](Script.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#ScriptEditor_signal_script_close)

Emitted when editor is about to close the active script. Argument is a [Script](Script.md) that is going to be closed.

## Method Descriptions

<a id="ScriptEditor_method_clear_docs_from_script"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **clear_docs_from_script**\ (\ script\: [Script](Script.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#ScriptEditor_method_clear_docs_from_script)

Removes the documentation for the given `script`.

\ **Note:** This should be called whenever the script is changed to keep the open documentation state up to date.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Script](Script.md) **get_current_script**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#ScriptEditor_method_get_current_script)

Returns a [Script](Script.md) that is currently active in editor.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

Returns an array with all [ScriptEditorBase](ScriptEditorBase.md) objects which are currently open in editor.

<a id="ScriptEditor_method_goto_help"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **goto_help**\ (\ topic\: [String](String.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#ScriptEditor_method_goto_help)

Opens help for the given topic. The `topic` is an encoded string that controls which class, method, constant, signal, annotation, property, or theme item should be focused.

The supported `topic` formats include ``class_name:class``, ``class_method:class:method``, ``class_constant:class:constant``, ``class_signal:class:signal``, ``class_annotation:class:@annotation``, ``class_property:class:property``, and ``class_theme_item:class:item``, where ``class`` is the class name, ``method`` is the method name, ``constant`` is the constant name, ``signal`` is the signal name, ``annotation`` is the annotation name, ``property`` is the property name, and ``item`` is the theme item.

```
    # Shows help for the Node class.
    class_name:Node
    # Shows help for the global min function.
    # Global objects are accessible in the `@GlobalScope` namespace, shown here.
    class_method:@GlobalScope:min
    # Shows help for get_viewport in the Node class.
    class_method:Node:get_viewport
    # Shows help for the Input constant MOUSE_BUTTON_MIDDLE.
    class_constant:Input:MOUSE_BUTTON_MIDDLE
    # Shows help for the BaseButton signal pressed.
    class_signal:BaseButton:pressed
    # Shows help for the CanvasItem property visible.
    class_property:CanvasItem:visible
    # Shows help for the GDScript annotation export.
    # Annotations should be prefixed with the `@` symbol in the descriptor, as shown here.
    class_annotation:@GDScript:@export
    # Shows help for the GraphNode theme item named panel_selected.
    class_theme_item:GraphNode:panel_selected
```


<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="ScriptEditor_method_goto_line"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **goto_line**\ (\ line_number\: [int](int.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#ScriptEditor_method_goto_line)

Goes to the specified line in the current script.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="ScriptEditor_method_open_script_create_dialog"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **open_script_create_dialog**\ (\ base_name\: [String](String.md), base_path\: [String](String.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#ScriptEditor_method_open_script_create_dialog)

Opens the script create dialog. The script will extend `base_name`. The file extension can be omitted from `base_path`. It will be added based on the selected scripting language.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="ScriptEditor_method_register_syntax_highlighter"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **register_syntax_highlighter**\ (\ syntax_highlighter\: [EditorSyntaxHighlighter](EditorSyntaxHighlighter.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#ScriptEditor_method_register_syntax_highlighter)

Registers the [EditorSyntaxHighlighter](EditorSyntaxHighlighter.md) to the editor, the [EditorSyntaxHighlighter](EditorSyntaxHighlighter.md) will be available on all open scripts.

\ **Note:** Does not apply to scripts that are already opened.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="ScriptEditor_method_unregister_syntax_highlighter"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **unregister_syntax_highlighter**\ (\ syntax_highlighter\: [EditorSyntaxHighlighter](EditorSyntaxHighlighter.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#ScriptEditor_method_unregister_syntax_highlighter)

Unregisters the [EditorSyntaxHighlighter](EditorSyntaxHighlighter.md) from the editor.

\ **Note:** The [EditorSyntaxHighlighter](EditorSyntaxHighlighter.md) will still be applied to scripts that are already opened.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="ScriptEditor_method_update_docs_from_script"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **update_docs_from_script**\ (\ script\: [Script](Script.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#ScriptEditor_method_update_docs_from_script)

Updates the documentation for the given `script`.

\ **Note:** This should be called whenever the script is changed to keep the open documentation state up to date.
